我不想喜欢jill了。
原因有很多。
他是屏幕那头的人，我是屏幕这头的人，两条平行线注定碰不到一起。
他是为了挣我的米才与我接触的。他是受万人喜爱的角色，我只不过一介平凡少年，无论我多么喜欢，在他那里注定得不到任何反馈……
我想通了，于是决定放弃。下一个视频略过，视频通通删干净，眼不见心不烦，还能留出时间内卷，这不是好事一桩?
第二天，我正常起床，洗漱，吃饭，没什么变数。我换好衣服，准备出门。当我踏出门外的那一刻，我才意识到，坏事了。
我不知道该往哪个方向迈出下一步。平时一览无余的街道，现在竟然充满了迷雾。
我仿佛是没有罗盘的一艘船，在茫茫大海里打转。四面八方都是海水，都是一样蓝，我该往哪走?我要去哪?我要干什么?
船没有了罗盘，我丢失了方向，人生缺少了目标。这是多么可怕的一件事，我做过的所有事情都化为了泡影，灰飞烟灭。
路边跳过一只橘色的猫，看了我一眼，好像在嘲笑我的落魄。
我害怕了。我逃回家里，打开电脑手机，把视频打开，把他的视频看了无数遍，直到午夜之时我沉沉睡去。
梦里我恍然大悟。人总要有个盼头，有个让你追逐的东西。它可以赋予你的努力以价值。原来这就是存在的意义啊，我所做的一切，不就是为了追逐，为了让他能笑着对我说，多亏了你，我才能好评如潮？
没错，jill与我确实是不可能的，但是他却让我的生活拥有了动力与目标
我不想喜欢jill了。
原因只有一个。
我已经爱上jill了。

185822035.review:
Va-11 Hall-A is a really chill game that gives you an emotionally resonant glimpse into the lives of a handful of bar attendees. It's a great character-driven experience that makes you care about not only Jill, but the customers she serves -- both regulars who come in on a regular basis and people who sparsely visit. The music slaps too, and the Jukebox function lets you pick your favorites and play them as you serve drinks.

(Also look up Flaming Moai if you want secret guests)

185820683.review:
Que jogo gostoso!! A princípio fiquei interessada pela arte em pixel-art e temática cyberpunk, mas por ser uma visual novel onde VOCÊ é uma barista é algo que também imaginei que seria interessante (me lembrou daqueles flash games)... e não fiquei desapontada! Os personagens são muito distintos entre si, cativantes, profundos e repletos de nuances, que ao se tornarem clientes frequentes vão se abrindo e se conectando com a protagonista, a Jill Stingray, que por sua vez, também tem seus mistérios (meus personagens favs são a chefe e a Jill apesar de ter muito carinho pelos outros). Além disso, o jogo possui um humor meio tosco e absurdista que pessoalmente, eu adoro... 

A platina é tranquila, menos um minigame bullet hell que, como o nome diz, é INFERNALLLLLLL (mas pra história esse minigame é irrelevante e só desbloqueia a partir de uma ação X). Inclusive, o jogo em si, não tem dificuldade nenhuma, só é importante ler o que está sendo dito mas nenhum erro prejudica tanto assim, e eu recomendaria jogar mais de uma vez e tentar fazer "escolhas" diferentes, as vezes você pode acabar conhecendo novas facetas dos seus clientes...

Único problema é que não tem tradução em PT-BR, fora isso é uma ótima experiência. Recomendo demais!

185786981.review:
I usually don't like VNs, but I found the art style and premise of VA-11 Hall-A always interesting. I finally bought it and it's exactly what it looks like on the screenshots - serving wacky people drinks in a cyberpunk environment. Yeah, there is little gameplay in itself, but it's a VN after all. There isn't really any depth to the mixing mechanic, but what kept me hooked was the story and characters. The story makes a fine effort to immediately pull you in on each characters back story and current sorrows, and by the end of the game you kinda wish you could spend more time with them.

Jill is an incredibly relatable character. The narrative turning point of her story halfway through left me positively dumbfounded staring at the screen. It's not what you expect to happen at all, especially if you were yourself in a similar situation once.

The music is good in the context of the game, but in itself mostly average (I bought it from Bandcamp directly from the artist).

It's well worth to play it only for the story, and I highly recommend to check out all available endings (with a guide if necessary).

There are two negative points that are worth mentioning explicitly:
1. Several of the achievements for each characters ending are incredibly obtuse without a guide. Some are even downright impossible to get because the game simply doesn't contain the necessary information (it requires to have played another, unrelated game). NG+ makes it relatively easy to blitz through the game again with a guide though.
2. One of the achievements just doesn't belong in a game like this, and if you're mechanically not good at that specific thing, you have to cheat.


Alma is best girl

185707345.review:
As far as visual novels go, VA-11 Hall-A (stylized as Valhalla) is a cozy and relaxing experience. The game features a type of storytelling that draws inspiration from titles like Papers, Please. In Valhalla, fragments of the story and the game’s universe are revealed through the dialogues of customers who frequent the Valhalla bar and the texts you can read on blogs, news sites, and online forums accessed via the protagonist's phone. Initially, the narrative may seem fragmented, but as you get to know the cast of characters, it starts to form a cohesive picture. The atmosphere becomes increasingly engaging, and you grow attached to the world and its inhabitants. What stood out to me most about the game was its cyberpunk, dystopian vibe and the vibrant, quirky cast of regulars at the bar. This future setting feels eerily close to what our own reality could become in terms of societal values and human behavior.

The gameplay brings a sense of coziness, with fun characters, jokes, and amusing moments. At the same time, it offers a dynamic element through the need to mix drinks tailored to what the customers are asking for—or what they might secretly need based on their mood. While the core mechanics of the game can be criticized as simplistic and repetitive, it's important to note that the game isn’t designed to be a fully-fledged bartending simulator. Instead, it’s a cyberpunk visual novel with bartending mechanics that prevent the experience from becoming too passive. The gameplay’s focus lies not on technical complexity but on the player’s ability to listen (or read, in this case), pay attention to the characters’ traits and personalities, and interpret their words and feelings. The reward for doing this well is twofold: you unlock more details and stories about each client’s life, and you earn more money for making flawless drinks. This, in turn, affects the game’s endings and your relationships with the characters.

The story unfolds through the perspective of Jill Stingray, a bartender at Valhalla, located in Glitch City—a cyberpunk metropolis governed by mega-corporations. These corporations use the city as a testing ground for experimental technologies, such as AI and nanomachines. The game features a diverse cast of characters, each with unique traits and compelling personal struggles. As a bartender, Jill gets glimpses into the lives of her customers, allowing players to piece together a broader picture of Glitch City. This city grapples with numerous issues and imperfections, brought to light through interactions with humans, intelligent humanoid robots, and even a talking corgi named Rad Shiba. Each character adds depth to the world-building, contributing to the game’s themes and atmosphere. The dialogue spans philosophical, emotional, and humorous topics, offering dialogues that can range from thought-provoking discussions about emotions, psychology, AI, technology, and the role of mega-corporations in controlling people’s lives to really mundane and slice-of-life moments.

If you’re already a fan of visual novels, this game will certainly satisfy your craving for great characters, an immersive atmosphere, and engaging dialogue. With its mix of humor, philosophy, and emotion, all wrapped in a dystopian cyberpunk aesthetic, VA-11 Hall-A is a must-play.

4年前，刚刚步入大学的我不巧就遇到了疫情，只能呆在家中上着网课。那种对于校园生活的新鲜感以及向往慢慢地被堆叠的课业掩所盖，每天和朋友们通过游戏打发时间并焦虑着下一个ddl。
就这样，一直到一次，偶然间打开了VA11HallA后出门忘记关掉，晚上买完东西回来后仍苦恼于接下来的essay时，昏暗的屋内传来了空灵的科幻音乐，不大的屏幕上仍停留在我走时的标题界面，看着那与现实相差甚远的世界中，性格经历各不相同的角色一次又一次地出现在吧台前要上一杯自己所喜好的酒并跟酒保分享自己的故事，这样慢节奏的游戏在静静地等待我下一次回到桌前拾起鼠标就好像在提醒着我，无论生活的节奏如何，人们都至少应该有喝上那么一杯的暇余（虽然我自己并不喝酒）。

185440698.review:
是一个很温暖的游戏啊，尤其和红弦俱乐部比起来。经典的赛博朋克世界观，科技寡头用纳米技术感染每一个民众，把整座城市变成自己的游乐园，让白骑士成为辖制民众的私兵。上层腐败泛滥，民间黑帮横行，明明是一个典型的黑残深故事背景，但整个故事意外的美好和温暖。
​       里面出现的每一个女角色和大部分男角色都很古怪而可爱，她们在酒后慷慨地分享自己的故事，虽然每个人的设定都显得格外特立独行——漂亮的天才黑客、儿童仿生人性工作者、二十四小时全天候直播网红、机器人超级偶像、赏金猎人，但实际表现出来的格外生动真实。担忧会让母亲难过、操心难搞的姐姐、困扰于无人在乎的孤独，在五光十色的霓虹灯下每个人/仿生人展现出的困惑与痛苦依旧是千百年来的人性。
       故事的主角，双马尾，在故事的开头永远是一副酷酷的专业调酒师范儿，只倾听，不参与，对最难搞的客人也能维持职业道德。但随着故事的展开逐渐引出了Jill的过往，坚持自由不惜与女友决裂，担心爱人的负面情绪直到一切无法挽回，归根结底还是自由、爱情与死亡。好在最后制作人给了一个相对美好的结局，让Jill和过往和解了。尽管故事的结尾有些猝不及防，许多谜题都没有解答，但也许这正是这个游戏的魅力。
        在这样一个操蛋的世界，我们永远不会出门去发现那个持续了一晚上的响声到底是鞭炮还是枪击，只需要为一群可爱的（亦或是没那么可爱的）家伙们在合适的地方送上一杯合适的饮品，倾听他们的故事，与他们一起度过mega圣诞、新年就好了。宽容地允许一些不被解开的谜题，不被说出口的爱的存在，在天塌下来前一夜调好piano woman和brantin。
       游戏的玩法我不太喜欢，非常单调的点点点，有点考验细心，不然就得重来。但文本确实过硬，每个酒的描述也很有趣。可惜不知道是不是中文翻译的问题，时不时有一些令人不适登味文本，有机会可以试试英文版的。

185400361.review:
I usually don't write full proper reviews on games but I have a lot of thoughts here so I will. 

So I think the world building in this great is fantastic and the primary strong suit, you don't really leave the bar for dialogue yet you are able to slowly understand this entire world and the city you're placed in. There's never a moment where the game just lore dumps on you, and you have to piece it together from dialogue, which I think makes a significantly better experience. Now I think the character writing is decent, some are great and other's are kind of eh, the game does suffer from "Anime tropes" and is really horny for no reason sometimes. Like I don't think sexual topics/sex jokes in the game are inheriently bad but the "hacker girl has big boobs" joke gets tiring quick. There where a couple moments throughout which I'm like "why was this even here?" like for example [spoiler]when your imagination/schizophrenia? (Still not sure what the deal of that was) starts speaking to you, it added nothing and was never expanded on and was only included near the end of the game so I was left confused why it was even included.[/spoiler] and characters come in with depression and one word changes there whole life perspective. The actual gameplay is small, at most its remembering someones order or diciphering what they want, and having to pay your bills or buy something jill wants, although I am kind of glad about this I get the intention is to make a relaxing game and I think they did a great job at that and If they did focus harder on gameplay I think it would of detracted from the main experince. The game I think is the perfect length, it took me about 11 hours any shorter and I feel like it would be missing, any longer and I think it would of felt repetitive. So I think the game is incredibly charming and the ending was very sweet, I recommend it if this slightly peaks your interest.

btw sorry for the run on sentences and spelling mistakes.

Мужик ответил: "Было время, когда я приходил в бар с двумя лучшими друзьями. Мы любили выпить по кружке пива. Но потом судьба разлучила нас. Два моих друга уехали в другие города. Но мы договорились, что каждый из нас, если захочет выпить, будет заказывать и на себя, и на друзей. И выпивать за них. Это помогает нам не забывать о нашей крепкой дружбе"
Бармен уважительно кивнул.
Мужик продолжал приходить в бар, но наступил день, когда он заказал две кружки пива. В следующий раз опять две.
Бармен догадался, что с одним из друзей мужика что-то произошло. Он подошёл и сочувственно произнёс: "Вы теперь заказываете по две кружки пива, я так понимаю, что с одним из ваших друзей что-то случилось?"
Мужик оторвался от пива: "Что? Нет, с моими друзьями всё прекрасно, это просто я пить бросил"

185237460.review:
[h1]Time to mix drinks and change lives.[/h1]

VA-11 Hall-A определенно одна из лучших новелл в своем жанре и без сомнений стоит всего потраченного на нее времени и денег. Хоть я и получил немного не то, что ожидал, но тем не менее итоговый результат очень даже высок.

[b]Действия игры разворачиваются в утопическом киберпанк-городе Глитч-сити, а если быть конкретнее - небольшом баре, который местные называют по-простому "Вальхалла". Главная героиня - девушка по имени Джилл, которая работает здесь барменом, собственно, весь сюжет и строится вокруг этой работы. Ей приходится выслушивать множество историй, знакомиться со многими колоритными персонажами, узнавать их предпочтения (этот аспект не так сильно развит как хотелось бы), да и самой постепенно раскрываться перед игроками. Вдобавок к этому, необходимо ежедневно утолять ее хотелки в виде покупок всякой всячины в магазине, иначе она будет отвлекаться на работе. Далее более подробно о том, что мне понравилось и я считаю плюсом. [/b]

[h3]1. Визуальный стиль.[/h3]

Пиксель-арт в игре на самом деле потрясающий, все персонажи прорисованы очень детально и живо, все выглядит ярко и цветасто, но не вырвиглазно, любителям подобного наверняка понравится.

[h3]2. Персонажи.[/h3]

Это один из самых главных плюсов игры и то, ради чего и стоит покупать данную игру. Практически каждый уникален и запоминающийся, думаю, что здесь любой сможет найди своего любимчика. Очень много как забавных диалогов, так и достаточно серьезных на важные темы (хотя первых больше, я не знаю как на русском, но в английской версии смешочков ну прям очень много). Некоторые персонажи имеют свои предпочтения в напитках, что необходимо запоминать, и вот таких моментов хотелось бы побольше, но увы.

[h3]3. Музыка. [/h3]

Это второй из самых главных плюсов игры. Музыка здесь также очень подходящая, ее довольно много и она прям идеально подходит к выше упомянутому визуальному стилю. Свой плейлист ты каждый раз настраиваешь перед началом смены и после перерыва, единственное, что расстраивает, так это отсутствие кнопки "зарандомить" плейлист, чтобы не проставлять новые самому.

[h3]4. Главная героиня.[/h3]

Я бы не сказал, что она прям настолько интересный и классный персонаж, но.. В последнее время так редко видишь главных героев, которые представляют из себя действительно что-то стоящее, что решил выделить ее отдельно. Любит поболтать, остра на язык во многих моментах, имеет непростую судьбу, есть имплант, который позволяет пить ей больше пива (лол), в общем - интересная девушка.

А на этом, наверное, и все. Геймплея в новелле ждать не приходится, хоть тут и есть миниигра (которая, однако, быстро надоедает) со смешиванием напитков, на которой этот геймлей и строится, но все же это не так важно. 

Минусов в игре как будто объективно мало, но если субъективно, то для меня это концовка. Просто ждал большего, чем показали в итоге. Ах да, [strike]большое спасибо[/strike] за добавление миниигры в виде [spoiler]буллет-хелла по ощущениям из tohou project (утрируя), который очень тяжело пройти, а к ней еще и ачивка привязана.[/spoiler]

[h1]Итоговая оценка:
8/10[/h1]

185218446.review:
VA11 Hall-A is a good game for anyone who doesn't frequent bars, like me. You get to fuck up drinks, ask too many questions to customers, and pretend to give a fuck to the surrounding concrete grid's various catastrophes. I think as for one of my first real VN-type games, I was pleasantly surprised how the game starts to make the characters' drunk backstories, their worries, and reactions to each-other feel almost natural. What's more, you start to hope the Cat Boomer walks in the door so Jill can say "eye" and see her reaction, or that the gruff assassin will ask for a hard drink so he hopefully will open up to you. You start playing the game to see how a hacker, catgirl, ex-wrestler, pompous buffoon, and a robot's vet girlfriend relate to one another. And the game shines in the context category. What seemed like a previous, humorous off-hand mention becomes a key clue into a major event a week later later.

This game is good stuff. If only I actually liked alchohol.

185115389.review:
常看常新，在不同阶段都能得到不同的思考和感受。
       初次购入及游玩是在21年的高一，疫情的阴霾和未开的心智使我对这个游戏的印象仅停留于有趣的未来畅想与独特的调酒情调，那时的这款游戏或许对我来讲只是一枚精致的小甜品，而因学业和有限的电脑使用也使得我并未读完这个故事，但它就如我视觉小说的白月光般一直牵动着心弦。
       在经历了一些低谷并逐渐走出之后，我回归了正常生活，大二的闲暇使我再次打开了这个始终牵挂的游戏，阅历和心智的提升让我从中读出了不同的东西：对现实的影射以及辛辣讽刺，对人情冷暖的乖张刻画和描写；这个发生在207X年的故事如此的平实，它区别于2077所营造的霓虹光景和速度激情，将灯光聚焦至一间小酒吧的“调制饮料，改变人生”。我从中感受到了我经历过的或正在经历的生活，它并不轻浮膨胀，而是切实地描写着能真切感受的冷暖人情，或许这个故事及也过于理想化，但确实让我感受到暖意和慰籍。
       VA-11 Hall-A，平实有趣而真切的故事，希望我下次回味时还能有如此感动。

184819835.review:
5/5
This is, quite possibly, the best visual novel I've ever played.
Instead of making typical dialogue choices (outside of one excursion as a post-game extra) you serve people drinks. Jill (the player avatar) does all the talking herself.
Also, I don't think I've played any other video game with dialogue that sounds so... human. So many conversations rely on you remembering context for things mentioned earlier in the game, and while there's no penalty for forgetting, it is interesting connecting the dots of the world.
Anyways, [i]VA-11 Hall-A: Cyberpunk Bartender Action[/i] is in my top five video games ever made. It does everything I think a visual novel should, which is to have an interesting story and characters that you can interact with but without gameplay being too distracting from the concept.

Despite being bogged down by the occasional lewd line or joke that felt forced or out of place 
VA-11 Hall-A provides a consistently engaging narrative experience with just enough interactivity to hold your interest

It tells an incredibly personal tale and an emotionally gripping one at that, I'm sure you'll find at least one character you'll relate to as each have their own baggage and personal issues, the music , aesthetic and atmosphere are all lovely

Though word of warning the writing can be very abrasive and sexual, it fits the world and themes but I don't expect it to be everyone's cup of tea
but if the style works for you then there's plenty to love

Few games for me hold the honour of being side splittingly hysterical while also making me feel deep sadness  with it's emotional beats and managing your tone so well to achieve that effect takes artistry 

In summary I loved this game and if it's themes or aesthetic seem interesting to you I cannot recommend it enough

I have been meaning to play this game for years as the music and art style had immediately captured me. I finally gave it a go after a friend recommended it; I am glad I finally did!

Besides the amazing art and music, I enjoyed the story. It starts off a bit general but once you get to know the patrons you quickly get invested in them. The bartending mechanic is basically how you make choices in the game. More often than not, you will follow what the customer wants. However, sometimes it pays to ignore their request and use what you know about the patron to prepare the drink. As more time progressed, I related to the protagonist more and more.

Overall, a very nice experience. A cosy and bittersweet game.

184313492.review:
VA-11 Hall-A, o più semplicemente Valhalla, è un titolo speciale.

Partiamo con il dire che si tratta di un gioco che ricerca la sua estetica nell'epoca PC-98, pertanto stiamo parlando di qualcosa di un po' più specifico di quanto potrebbe sembrare a prima vista.
Anche la colonna sonora, su cui potremmo avere in parte gestione giorno per giorno, è molto ispirata e funziona molto bene nel suo ruolo di "compagna" di viaggio.

Il vero motore dell'intero gioco sta però nella narrativa: è incredibile quanto lentamente ma inesorabilmente riusciremmo a calarci nei panni di Jill, bartender in una città futuristica Cyberpunk che deve avere a che fare con la sua clientela giorno per giorno. Lo sviluppo della storia ci porterà quindi a conoscere diverse persone e la loro storia personale, entrando man mano sempre più in confidenza con loro.

Non è un caso che abbia parlato di "giorno per giorno", perché il titolo è composto da 19 giornate che vanno dal 13 al 31 Dicembre (più quattro giornate di prologo e una di epilogo, se vogliamo essere precisi). Un consiglio spassionato che do a chiunque voglia approcciarsi a questo titolo è infatti quello di non avere fretta: durante una vostra giornata giocate una sola giornata del gioco, cercando di affrontare il titolo un pezzetto alla volta.
Questo aiuta molto a vivere la narrazione del titolo per come è stata pensata, senza avere troppa fretta e lasciando che man mano i vari personaggi che la compongono diventino, in qualche modo, parte anche della nostra quotidianità.

Specifico in conclusione che il titolo tratta tematiche piuttosto mature, pur non mostrando mai alcuna scena esplicita.

184254196.review:
Great game!

VA-11 Hall-A is a bartending game that focuses primarily on progressing the story through dialogue and mixing drinks for different customers. It’s most similar in genre to a visual novel / mixing sim and is developed by Sukeban Games and published by Ysbryd Games, PLAYISM. It released back in Jun 21 of 2016. I had no history with this title except from hearing about all of the glowing reviews from friends who did have experience with it. I picked it up to see what all the fuss was about and wasn’t expecting anything too revolutionary as I’ve played mixology games before, kind of like Coffee Talk, which is another title that I really enjoyed. 

The plot focuses on a woman bartending at a local dive within a far flung future cyberpunk-esq city. Here she engages with and speaks with various different patrons that impart on her the difficulties of life and the goings and happenings of the city outside. You’ll learn more about these characters and become more engaged in the world as you mix drinks to their satisfaction and progress the narrative. The story is quite compelling and explores various themes of culture and civilization. Government, religion, politics, ethics, and morals are all explored through dialogue. The length of this title is well paced, and I would say very suited for the scope and breadth of the story. 

Core gameplay focuses on clicking through dialogue and mixing drinks to customers satisfaction. You have different ingredients that you can add to drinks and this will impact the kinds of drinks that you can make for customers. You’ll become more familiar with the menu as time goes on and may even memorize some of the ingredients to make regular recurring drinks that patrons will ask for. There are also hidden menu drinks that you can mix that will impact the outcome of certain dialogue sequences as well as achievements and endings for the story. I will say it’s a satisfying gameplay loop and there’s nothing that sticks out about it as a drag. Controls are fine and can be interacted with through either clicking or on the keyboard. I would say using the keyboard is far superior as it is faster, but I don’t think this title does a very good job of relaying to you the player that the keyboard is an option, so be aware of that. There is no difficulty setting to the game, just the one experience. It neither gets more or less difficult, there is no time crunch or goal, just mixing drinks. It’s a very chill experience. 

The visual style of this title is very anime. Characters are cute, kawaii, grizzled, buff, smooth, and more. It’s hyper stylized and the art design fits the style quite well. It’s not off-putting, but does have a look to it. There isn’t really any animation but there is movement to imply reactions, and there’s a good amount of detail within the characters and background itself. The background rarely, if ever changes, so there’s not going to be much to look at there, which is fine since the characters themselves are the focus of the experience. The game runs well, and I didn’t have any performance issues. 

The soundtrack is quite good, although it’s not anything I haven’t heard before within a cyberpunk game. It complements the theme well, and has a pixelation vibe which is shockingly accurate to the vision here. There’s no voice acting within the game, just text sounds, so it’s up to your imagination as to how the characters sound. 

There is no variety within your environment. It’s the same bar every single day. There’s no exploration in the world, only exploration through dialogue. This can be repetitive depending on your expectations. This isn’t really an action packed experience here. Immersion occurs entirely through what the other characters relay to you, so you’ll have to pay close attention to what they are saying and have some level of social awareness to pick up on various cues that happen. 

This is actually a somewhat lengthy experience, average gameplay time lasting around 11 hours, roughly 18 if you want to 100% it, although it only took me around 15 to do so. There’s not really any “endgame” content, and replayability is limited to achievement hunting or exploring various mystery drink options. There’s a lot here to chew on though, and if you’re interested in an involved narratively driven story then this is for you. 

Final verdict is 5/5. This is for anyone that enjoys dialogue/click heavy story experiences, similar to Coffee Talk (almost one in the same actually). I probably won’t ever play this again, but I am excited to see the sequel that they are apparently working on. There’s also a Va-11 Hall-A addition to the popular TTRPG Cyberpunk Red that might be worth checking out if that’s your thing.

184231343.review:
这个游戏太适合最近的精神状态了，优秀到还没打通就想推荐。典型的赛博朋克式的都市，垄断、科技、腐败、犯罪……当然还有黄色的部分。不过关于这部分，我甚至是翻游戏音乐的评论区才知道这归类为一款galgame——实际上，在我看来几乎没有什么露骨的内容，只不过是群友之间会开的黄色玩笑的程度，显得自然且恰到好处。

最近入手实在是巧合但是应景。游戏里也是12月份，上周Jill他们刚刚开过Mega圣诞派对，下周末又准备一起办一个跨年派对。我还没推到下周末，不过，我实在太期待了。相比现实生活，既没有圣诞假期、也没有跨年假期，更没有人一起开party，Va-11 Hall-a的跨年party实在是让人期盼。

也许未必适合所有人的所有阶段，人人有自己的生活，有时候，生活烂到恰到好处，或许刚好对上游戏的节奏。这游戏本身也的确算得上是一个赛博酒吧——要是生活一切顺利，游戏里未必能收获更多——就像是选一个恰当的时候酗酒。我太需要了，我太喜欢了。

183901195.review: Surprisingly addictive, if it wasn't for my uselessness in the bullet hell minigame, I would have gone for all the achievements in this game. I did see all the endings, though, which is a rare occurrence in my case, because I usually play a game once and don't try other routes. But! The art style, all these memorable characters and sci-fi vibes... I was instantly sold. Also, there are some real bangers in the soundtrack. Loved it there, I was extremely invested in the little plots here and there... wish there were more story-based cyberpunk games like this. The only problem I had was that some of the content was hidden behind the knowledge one would have from another game's easter egg and the only way for me to figure this out was to look for hints in the internet. I know, I know, secret content wouldn't be secret then, but I would rather have to figure this secret out by gathering clues in the game itself. Sooo... this one task was, in my opinion, a little too lazy in its execution. But I am pointing this out mostly as a way of finding a single thing I did not like. Other stuff I could say? Pretty easy to master, pretty cosy, makes connecting the dots from the information dropped by the patrons extremely enjoyable, and I did enjoy the "other" perspective on events that might be occuring in a sci-fi/cyberpunk setting. Not the superhero kind of stuff, but an average bartender-turned-almost-therapist who "mixes drinks and changes lives".

183900646.review:
VA-11 Hall-A fue una experiencia gratificante y novedosa, pues no todos los días te encuentras con una novela visual que posea una temática cyberpunk, y que, a su vez, logre el objetivo de ser tan llamativa y pintoresca en su ejecución. 
Aquellos aspectos se evidencian de mejor manera en cómo Jill, nuestra protagonista, se relaciona con los diversos clientes que visitan VA-11 Hall-A a lo largo del juego. En el proceso se logra escuchar y atender la vida diaria en la que cada uno de estos personajes se ve envuelto en este mundo distópico y los dilemas que en éste se presentan sin dejar de lado los propios asuntos que a Jill le acomplejan. Sumado a aquello me es imposible no mencionar un aspecto que rápidamente te enamora, y aquel es la increíble banda sonora que logra ambientar muy bien la distopía y carisma que presenta el juego desde el minuto uno. Siendo así que al inicio de cada día de trabajo y en los breaks, puedas tu mismo seleccionar la música que deseas que suene durante el resto de la sesión (muchas veces dejaba el juego encendido con la banda sonora de fondo mientras hacía otras cosas, es realmente una ganancia). 
Si bien el juego no posee opciones de diálogos como lo suelen tener la mayoría de novelas visuales, no quiere decir que el final siempre sea inmutable y el mismo. Al contrario, hay muchos finales y hasta clientes secretos que solo lograrás conseguir si realizas ciertos pedidos en ciertas circunstancias o si compras ciertos ítems con tu sueldo de bartender. Para ello debes prestar mucha atención y conectar con los personajes recurrentes, cosa que el juego siempre potencia en todo momento debido a los aspectos previamente mencionados. 
VA-11 Hall-A es un juego sin lugar a dudas invito a probar. Es un juego que puedes disfrutar y tomártelo con calma, es un momento donde puedes desconectar por unos instantes de nuestra realidad y echarle un vistazo a lo que nos tiene que entregar su universo. No es necesario sacar todos los finales y todos los logros para quedar encantado con el juego, pero incluso si decides tomarte el tiempo no quedarás decepcionado al ver nuevos diálogos y episodios de vida de tus personajes favoritos. Juega VA-11 Hall-A, es de esos juegos que fácilmente te marcan y quedan guardados en la biblioteca de tu cerebro como un linda y grata experiencia.

调制人生，改变饮料

va11是一部很赞的视觉小说，它不是那种“传统式”的赛博朋克：一上来就是什么父母趋势欠款百万只能怎样怎样还债因为我们是赛博朋克我们的世界观就是这么黑暗。va11讲的是普通人的故事，玩家要做的很简单，给顾客上饮料，和顾客聊天。由于其特殊的世界观，一些思考就会变得很有意思，比如多萝西对自己身份的思考，以及吉尔是选择逃避过去还是勇敢地面向未来。我只能说，BEST BOSS,BEST,JILL。
va11的剧情可以说是十分沉浸和享受了，总共游玩了两次，第二次的感觉和第一次是不一样的，不过建议忘忘剧情再二周目（。正如游戏开头所说的那般，它建议你配上一杯酒和几个小零食，在一个休闲的下午充分享受它精彩而温柔的剧情。

183644818.review:
I just want to say, I saw this game on instagram months ago (2024) and finished it on Christmas Day, which is kinda fitting but maybe I could've held out until new years eve if I REALLY wanted to match it up.

This game is really cool, the unlikable characters somehow find their way into being funny or funny to hate and the likeable characters are exactly that (I should mention this is a character driven game if you haven't gathered that from your store page impression so far). I think part of that strength is due to the very well balanced exposure levels of each individual and the difference of personalisation for characters we were supposed to see the endgame for vs who we weren't supposed to see the endgame for. It's very well done in the way that it feels more natural than exclusionary.

My other strength of note for this title is how an overall narrative is combined with so many individual narratives, including your playable protagonist Jill. This has a couple benefits, the first is how I can easily give you a spoiler free review because a large amount of the story is impression based, you might like some characters I like less. The second is that everyone brings something to the table, ranging from world building, dystopian concepts, interesting futures and just well crafted individualism. Really good, time to get back in my cave and farm the other endings.

Alma is peak friend material, I wished I liked Betty and Deal more, 9.5/10
